definition: to weave/to plait/to organize/to group/to arrange/to edit/to compile/to write/to compose/to fabricate
to make known/to show/to prove/to write/book/outstanding

sentences.english: With great concentration is mainly to help mentor young Master Chen edited by cooking the books, and so on.
sentences.chinese: 现主要潜心协助恩师陈绪荣大师编著烹饪书籍等工作。

sentences.english: The Longman Grammar of Spoken and Written English is an entirely new grammar…
sentences.chinese: 《朗文英语口语和笔语语法》由英国的拜伯等人编著。

sentences.english: Surelyreference works need to be compiled by experts?
sentences.chinese: 参考文献真的需要专家编著吗？

sentences.english: Also he compiled a dictionary that had over 10,000 entries.
sentences.chinese: 他还编著了一本超过一万个条目的字典。

sentences.english: She says the book will have alternating chapters by Ehrlich and by her.
sentences.chinese: 她说这本书将包括她和欧利希两人交错编著的章节。

sentences.english: Growth in the number of articles and edits has also levelled off.
sentences.chinese: 但是，编著文章数量的增长趋于平稳。

sentences.english: Reference Book:Quality Control on Concrete, Shern Jen Far.
sentences.chinese: 混凝土品质控制，沈进发编著，印行。

sentences.english: Fu says she spends about 20 hours a week on the book.
sentences.chinese: Fu说她一周大约花费20小时来编著这本书。

sentences.english: Veterinary Bacteriology and Virology Merchant &Packer. Seventh Edition.
sentences.chinese: 兽医微生物学上册，刘荣标编著，艺轩图书出版社。

sentences.english: The criteria for its literary criticism are respectively based on two perspectives: collection of historical materials and compilation of historical biographies.
sentences.chinese: 其立论标准，分别基于史料采集与史传编著两个视角。

definition: a series of books/a collection of books
